subject: Investing
title: Insider Trading: Legal and Illegal
description: A quick win: understand Insider Trading: Legal and Illegal.

hook.text: Martha Stewart went to prison for selling stock based on a tip. The trade saved her $45,000. The fine cost millions.

buildup.text: Illegal insider trading means buying or selling stock using material, non-public information.

discovery.text: Legal insider trading exists too. Executives can trade their own company stock â€” they just must report it publicly.

twist.text: Tracking legal insider buys can be useful. When a CEO buys millions of their own stock, it signals confidence.

climax.text: The SEC monitors unusual trading before big announcements. Algorithms flag suspicious patterns automatically.

punchline.text: Information is power. Using it unfairly is a crime.

quiz.question: What makes insider trading illegal?
options: Using material, non-public information to trade
Any executive buying their own stock
Trading more than 1,000 shares at once
